result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard N Martinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must comply with all Sex Offender registration requirement. Must abide by all conditions given by the Probation Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard N Martinson

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard N Martinson in court with attorney Wilber Rex Johnson.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:10  Court relates and gives appearances.
2:11  State makes recommendation.
2:12  Court questions defendant.
2:17  State relates.
2:18  Atty. Johnson relates.
2:19  Richard Martinson makes statement.
2:21  Court relates.

Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
State and defense waive PSI.  Court accepts waiver.

SW
2 years probation
Comply with all Sex Offender Registration requirements
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge.
Abide by all conditions given by PO.

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.
Voters ineligibility rights given to defendant

Defendant Richard N Martinson in court with attorney Wilber Rex Johnson.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Not guilty plea entered.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Richard N Martinson in court with attorney Wilber Rex Johnson.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:32 Amy Jain, sex offender registration specialist with the Department of Corrections, called, sworn and direct by State. 
1:38 Cross by Defense. 
1:42 Redirect by State. 
1:43 Recross by Defense. 
1:44 Testimony closed. 
Argument by Defense. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for trial. 
  Arraignment scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must comply with sex offender registry program.

Defendant Richard N Martinson in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde for today.  Defendant Richard N Martinson in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant. Blue form given to Defendant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
